title: How to Add a Pin on Google Maps on a PC or Mac

steps.title: Go to https://maps.google.com in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://maps.google.com in a web browser. If you’re not already signed in to your Google account, sign in now by clicking Sign in at the top-right corner of the screen. If you don't sign into a Google account, you'll only be able to place one pin per session; you won't be able to save pins for future use. If you're a business owner, you can add your business using a Business Profile. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Find the location you want to pin.
steps.content: Find the location you want to pin. You can enter a nearby landmark and click and drag your screen to find the location. If you enter a specific address into the search bar, a pin will be created there automatically.

steps.title: Click on the location.
steps.content: Click on the location. If you click an established landmark, store, or other location, a pop-up menu will open on the left, and the dot will turn into a pin. If you want to pin a spot with no established locations, such as an empty road, long-press it. However, you'll only see the option to route there .

steps.title: Click Save to save the pin.
steps.content: Click Save to save the pin. You can find this in the Overview tab, underneath the location's picture (if available). To find your saved pins, click ☰ in the top-left corner. Click Saved . If you want to pin frequent routes, you'll need to use the Google Maps mobile app. [2] X Research source
